statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Casper Ware scored 22 points and Long Beach State closed the game on a 24-8 run to defeat Cal State Northridge 79-62 Saturday night.
article.headline: Casper Ware powers Long Beach past CS Northridge
article.linkText: Ware powers Long Beach past CS Northridge
article.story: NORTHRIDGE, Calif. -- Casper Ware scored 22 points and Long Beach State closed the game on a 24-8 run to defeat Cal State Northridge 79-62 Saturday night. Larry Anderson added 17 points and Greg Plater 14 for the 49ers (15-10, 10-2 Big West), who solidified their hold on first place in the conference. T.J. Robinson had 10 points and 13 rebounds. Northridge (10-15, 7-5), which entered the game in a second-place tie with Cal Poly, was led by Rashaun McLemore with 15 points. Lenny Daniel added 14 and Josh Greene 12. Michael Lizarraga had 11 points and 11 rebounds. Long Beach led 55-54 with 7:49 left in the game before Ware hit four free throws, Plater nailed a 3-pointer and Eugene Phelps scored on a fast-break dunk during a 9-1 run to extend the lead to 64-55. Northridge shot just 36.4 percent from the field and 56.7 percent (17 for 30) from the free-throw line.
